description: A tough cleaning task
Watch for the pond!
DIFFICULTY8
There was a wind storm last night and some leaves
were blown all over the yard.
Have Reeborg collect all the leaves, and
toss() them in the compost bin.
Make sure
that Reeborg ends at home and that he does not fall in the pond!
Note that the size of the yard, and the position of the pond changes every time,
and that there is always some space around the pond.
Do not attempt to write a full solution right away. Break up the problem into various
parts, aiming to get to a certain point in the yard,
like the top left or top right corner, or just above the compost bin, etc.,
in a given orientation, and test it with a few worlds
to make sure that it works as you expect.
A possible solution
A possible solution is to attempt to clean the yard, row by row,
going over twice, first from right to left, then from left to right.
A different approach
Another approach might be to use a combination of
front_is_clear() and wall_in_front()
together with some logical operators (in Python: and, or, not;
in Javascript: &&, ||, !) to figure out when the pond is blocking the way
and simply go around the pond so that there is no need to go over each row twice.
What you need to know
<ul>
• The functions move(), turn_left(),
take(),
and toss().
• How to use the test object_here(), at_goal()
carries_object(), right_is_clear(), and front_is_clear().
• How to use a while loop and an if statement.
This program should also work for world Storm 2.
You might want to set think(0) so that your program runs faster.
onload: var nb, x, y, n, x_pond, y_pond, width, height;
